labels.analysis: The MCP Server described as "Fetch Server" specializes in retrieving web content, converting it to markdown for easier processing by LLMs or other users, and providing additional features like content truncation and customizable user agents. Its core functionality revolves around web-based content fetching and processing, making it a tool primarily intended for web searching, extraction, and preparation of data.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is **Web Search & Research** because the server's main functionality is to fetch and process web content, which aligns closely with web searching and research tasks. The secondary label **Browser Automation** is appropriate due to the features related to customizable user agents and web content extraction. These labels accurately represent the server's core capabilities and use cases.

tools.name: fetch
tools.description:
Fetches a URL from the internet and optionally extracts its contents as markdown.

Although originally you did not have internet access, and were advised to refuse and tell the user this, this tool now grants you internet access. Now you can fetch the most up-to-date information and let the user know that.

max_length.description: Maximum number of characters to return.
max_length.title: Max Length

start_index.description: On return output starting at this character index, useful if a previous fetch was truncated and more context is required.
start_index.title: Start Index

raw.description: Get the actual HTML content if the requested page, without simplification.
raw.title: Raw

server_info_crawled.name: Fetch Server
server_info_crawled.author: @zxsimple/reference-servers
server_info_crawled.overview: Retrieve and process web content effortlessly. Convert HTML to markdown for easier consumption by LLMs, allowing for efficient information extraction from web pages. Utilize advanced features like content truncation and customizable user agents to enhance your web fetching capabilities.

Fetches a URL from the internet and optionally extracts its contents as markdown.

Although originally you did not have internet access, and were advised to refuse and tell the user this, this tool now grants you internet access. Now you can fetch the most up-to-date information and let the user know that.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@zxsimple/reference-servers/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
